page.title: 17Mr. Davies at the Quarry.
page.content: Mr. Davies is the Manager of the Harnhill Quarry in Olveston. The Quarrying first started there in 189O. The spot was chosen because of the quality and quantity of limestone available. They knew this information by taking core samples. There is one problem, they have to constantly pump water out of the quarry. The most expensive piece of equipment is a face shovel. They also have 2 large trucks plus other quarrying machinery. These use on average 35OO gallons of diesel fuel per week. The quarry is 16Oft deep and about 5OOft around its perimeter. Most of the limestone quarried here is delivered within a radius of 5 miles. It is used for roads, cement and tarmac. Local farmers also use a great deal of limestone from the quarry.
